channel.title: Booting problem
channel.description:
I just installed Ubuntu and I am getting a problem booting it. Whats happening is that grub pops up before the kernel even loads. What can I do from the grub to get to my desktop?
I'm assuming that I would have to manually load the kernel then use the boot command, but how would I load the kernel? Don't give me justfuckinggoogleit.com

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

I’m using Wubi installer, it might work if i wasnt so lazy and actually went out to make a linux partition… ill try that

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Use a livecd and see if everything installed fine with Ubuntu, if thats ok I suppose you would have to re-install grub?

I know how to do this on Arch (I’ve had to do it a couple times :|), it should work the same way for Ubuntu because your just using the Arch disk to mount your current installation, login to it, and then run “grub-install”

Although I could be wrong.

That might not be your problem…

Anyway heres a link on how to reinstall grub with an Arch cd.

^ Like I said you should probably use a live cd to make sure Ubuntu is there before you try that ^

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem

item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

ah thats how you get to recovery mode and whatever, right? Yeah, I didn’t even get that screen. I booted and it went right to the terminal

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That is the grub terminal, no idea how you got to there. Doesn’t grub let you press ‘esc’ to view the entries when you boot?

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

the newest, ubuntu 8.04.1, kubuntu kde4 worked fine without me having to do that
thx for the help, im a newb with linux =/

EDIT: Error displayed when typing startx:
Error 27: Unrecognized command
and the error that I get when typing “boot” is that the kernel must be loaded for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Haha, that has nothing to do with Grub or the kernel…

Try “startx”. Failing that, which distro are you running?

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem

item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

Anyone remember windows 3.1? It would go into dos and you had to type “win” to get to the desktop. I am kinda in the same thing only its linux and I dont have the slightest clue about the linux commands =/, ill get an image of it in a bit

Read full topic

item.title: Booting problem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Uh… Grub is supposed to load before the kernel.
What is your exact problem? When does it hang, what error?

Read full topic
